intro: Citharexylum tenuifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved citharexylum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often found in heathlands and open forests. The plant features small, narrow leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement, and it produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. Its ornamental value is appreciated in gardens, and it is also used in traditional Aboriginal medicine. The species is known for its adaptability to coastal conditions and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
